items.text: length on middle stump, mistimed drive to mid-on
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: top edge is well short of fine leg. It's a short one outside off. It is also a slower ball. No control on the hooks but he's safe
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: full on leg stump, clipped straight to deep backward square
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mahmudullah, 1 run

items.text: beaten on the outside edge. Feet stuck in the crease. 151.1kph in the corridor and all his stumps are visible as he swishes at this
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: bouncer dug in too short and climbs over his helmet
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mahmudullah, 1 wide

items.text: taken, second attempt! Taylor reacts quicker to that than the batsman, but he has catching up to do as well. 150kph again from Ferguson. It's short and in the corridor, slanting in at the batsman. It's there for the cut, and that's what Mahmudullah looks to do. But this is just too quick for him and he gets the outside edge. Taylor lunges to his right and pops it up before keeping his head and grabbing it as it lobs behind him at first slip
items.postText: Tom Hazelhurst: "@Leebro. Might need to refresh Fergs average after that wicket."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mahmudullah, OUT

dismissal.text: Mahmudullah c Taylor b Ferguson 13 (41m 29b 0x4 0x6) SR: 44.82

items.text: short and up at off stump. Gets on top of the bounce to defend this
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: 154.9kph yorker just outside off. Looks to jam this through the off side but too late
items.postText: LeeBro: "@hayden There's a number of guys that deserve a prolonged chance in this setup like he's been given. And to be fair Southee has been running on previous form rather than actual for a long time. I'd look at the likes of Bennett, Rance, Tickner, Bracewell, Kuggeleijn, Jamieson..."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: short and up at off stump, defended off the back foot
items.postText: Rory: "Ferguson has come on great over the last year and is a welcome variation to our legion of fast-medium seamers but people need to stop thinking if you bowl the odd ball in the 150s your you're undroppable, all that matters is the overall value you add to the team, not the pace you bowl."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: full and wide outside off, sliced to third man's right off the front foot
items.postText: Cam: "Boult has to be up there with the absolute best quicks in the world right now - he's been lethal with the white ball recently. Great to see Henry in the wickets too - it's almost criminal that he's been stuck behind other guys for so long." --- Most wickets for a fast bowler since the last World Cup for Boult. 103 in 52 games. Closest pacer - Rabada with 98 in 62
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

items.text: short of a length at off stump, opens the face and runs it to point. Sent back as he looks to pinch a run
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: length at off, pushed to point off the back foot
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: short of a length and floating away wide outside off. Opens the face too early as he looks to run it down to third man. Under-edges to the keeper
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: length on off stump, defended from the crease
items.postText: Ahmad Awsaf: "Sorry, but where's Adam Milne? "
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: length on leg stump, clipped to fine leg off the back foot
items.postText: Darryn: "@LeeBro None of those guys have done anything to suggest they should be considered ahead of Ferguson who after a roughish start has been very good for some time now."
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

items.text: drilled to the point boundary. Nice shape on this drive from Sabbir. It's full and quite wide outside off, but he's leaned into his after getting onto his knees. Past cover point
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

items.text: short of a length outside off, left alone
items.postText: Dishant: "Soumya Sarkar has so much talent. I remember few of his inns in 2015 WC. All the potential and not the record to show for. Can anyone from BD tell what's the problem with him?"
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: and another. Between cover point and backward point this time. 152kph, overpitched and wide. Gets a nice connection on this drive, opens the face at the right moment
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

items.text: length at off stump, defended off the back foot
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: short of backward square. Awkward rising delivery at the underarm. Fends at it and gets a glove
items.postText: SeanTheMexican: "Also re Fergie, I think Nicholls shows the value of sticking with a player to give him a decent chance and a lot of confidence..."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: length on off stump, defended into the off side with feet rooted in the crease
items.postText: Warith Rahman: "I am from Bangladesh and support them, but they are collapsing very badly. I'll be surprised if they make over 180. They need 225+ though if they want a chance to win with the bowling unit the Tigers have."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: length and skidding on at a middle stump line. Defended into the leg side off the back foot
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: ramps it and finds four. Second time that he's forced a boundary against CDG. Skillful for sure, this guy. Length at off stump and he steps behind its line to lift it deftly past the keeper
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: length on off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run
